Legally Blonde.notes:
Kate Rockwell's first Elle. Had to record in STLP instead of ST because of space constraints on my dvr, due to the last-minuteness of attending. Act I audio'd from center orch- you can hear a couple of chatty aud members thru Omigod You Guys, I moved my dvr after. Act II audio'd from front row orch- Whipped Into Shape is AWFUL quality, way too instrument heavy, but again I moved my dvr after, the rest of Act II is fine. (Kate Shindle's mic wasn't turned on during the “we girls have to stick together” line in Remix, that's what happened in the dead air there.) Kate Rockwell messed up one line in Chip, and had a delayed entrance from the Chip costume change (Christian Borle had to vamp- “I see...pink...” etc.), otherwise her Elle was brilliant.

MY NOTES: I have two copies of this audio and I am not sure where the other one comes from. The other copy I have is 44 files and is 120.4 MB, but seems to be the same as the original files with one duplicated track

Legally Blonde.notes: Opening night! It starts raining during Daughter of Delta Nu, so that scene is slightly muffled because I had to cover my phone. The show is stopped right before What You Want due to the rain. During the scene at Deweys trailer, the knocking sound effect didnt work and Kyla kept knocking until it worked. There are a few sporadic mic problems, an alarm goes off during Whipped Into Shape and the people around me were chatty and can be heard from time to time. Since the Muny is outdoors, there are some outdoor noises throughout the show.

Waitress.notes: A solid quality audio taken by a friend of mine in the orchestra! My friend was very close so it gets a bit bass heavy at the heavier parts, but the dialogue and the softer numbers are perfectly clear. Sara gets huge entrance applause and Gavin gets nice applause (including huge screams by my friend) for his intro. This is Gavin's first show as Dr. Pommater and the return of Sara Bareilles and Larry Marshall to the show!

Waitress.notes: A beautiful quality audio taken by a friend of mine in the standing room! Definitely better and clearer quality than the 1/7 audio. Wicked.notes: First show back after COVID shutdown! The energy was insane through the entire show and made for such a magical return to Oz! The show began with a speech by Kristin Chenoweth. I also react A LOT to the show so I apologize if I'm annoying but also not because I'm a Wicked stan through and through and I've waited 556 days for this moment.

Wicked.notes:
Recorded before the show had ever been staged. Some minor plot differences and some different lyrics, and includes some songs that never made it to the show we know and love today (example: As If By Magic, part of a plot line that followed closer to the original novel.) No orchestra - the instrumental is just a piano backing everything. Stage directions spoken (example going into ALAYM: Scene four, a cheap rented room).
Recently replaced with a new, clearer, copy—this one including somewhere around 30 tracks, compared to 12.
